alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hamilton; Kearny; Morton; Stanton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:47PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morton, southern Hamilton, southwestern Kearny, western Grant, Stanton and northwestern Stevens Counties through 645 PM CDT/545 PM MDT/... At 547 PM CDT/447 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Johnson City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Morton, southern Hamilton, southwestern Kearny, western Grant, Stanton and northwestern Stevens Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Grant; Hamilton; Kearny; Morton; Stanton; Stevens
